'Kinect' (codenamed in development as 'Project Natal') is a motion sensing input
device by Microsoft for the Xbox 360 video game console and Windows PCs. Based
around a webcam-style add-on peripheral for the Xbox 360 console, it enables
users to control and interact with the Xbox 360 without the need to touch a game
controller, through a natural user interface using gestures and spoken
commands. |accessdate=
|archiveurl=http://blog.seattlepi.com/digitaljoystick/archives/169993.asp
|archivedate=}} The project is aimed at broadening the Xbox 360's audience
beyond its typical gamer base. |publisher=Los Angeles
Times|accessdate=|quote=The effort aims to attract a broader audience to
Microsoft's console. Most of the 30 million Xbox 360s sold since November 2005
have been snapped up by avid young males drawn to complex shooter or adventure
games such as Halo and Modern Warfare or R.P.Gs}} Kinect competes with the
Wii Remote Plus and PlayStation Move with PlayStation Eye motion controllers for
the Wii and PlayStation 3 home consoles, respectively. A version for Windows was
released on February 1, 2012.

Kinect was launched in North America on November 4, 2010, in Europe on November 10, 2010,
in Australia, New Zealand and Singapore on November 18, 2010, |accessdate=}}
|accessdate=}} and in Japan on November 20, 2010. |accessdate=}} Purchase options for the sensor
peripheral include a bundle with the game [[Kinect Adventures]] and console
bundles with either a 4 GB or 250 GB |accessdate=|publisher=Eurogamer|first=Robert|last=Purchese}} Xbox
360 console and Kinect Adventures. |publisher=Microsoft
|location=Redmond, Washington |accessdate=}} }} |archiveurl=http://www.joystiq.com/2010/07/20/kinect-bundled-with-
slim-4gb-xbox-360-arcade-for-300-new-
conso/|archivedate=|accessdate=|publisher=Twitter|quote=Euro prices are 149.99
Euro for the camera + Kinect Adventures, 299.99 Euro for the 4GB console
bundle.}}

The Kinect claimed the Guinness World Record of being the "fastest selling
consumer electronics device" after selling a total of 8 million units in its
first 60 days. |accessdate=}} |accessdate=}} }} 24 million
units of the Kinect sensor had been shipped as of January 2012.

Microsoft released Kinect software development kit for Windows 7 on June 16,
2011. |accessdate=}}
|accessdate=}} |accessdate=}} This SDK was meant to
allow developers to write Kinecting apps in C++/CLI, C#, or Visual Basic
.NET.
